alert.note: Alert for Maryland Beaches (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 29 at 6:21AM EDT until October 01 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...In Maryland, Maryland Beaches County. In Virginia, Accomack and Northampton Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM Friday to 6 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A second round of high surf conditions is expected late this weekend into early next week. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. OCEAN CITY INLET MD MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.5 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/11 AM 3.3 0.8 0.5 1 NONE 29/11 PM 3.1 0.6 0.7 1 NONE 30/12 PM 3.9 1.4 1.1 1 NONE 01/12 AM 3.7 1.2 1.4 1 NONE 01/01 PM 4.3 1.8 1.5 1 MINOR 02/01 AM 3.7 1.2 1.5 1 NONE SAXIS VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
